revised_title: Effects of Cycloheximide, Ouabain, and Ethacrynic Acid on Memory Inhibition in Chickens
tldr: The authors conducted experiments on chickens to study the effects of cycloheximide, ouabain, and ethacrynic acid on memory inhibition. They found that cycloheximide interferes with long-term memory, while ouabain and ethacrynic acid block access to short-term memory. These findings suggest that these chemicals may affect the early labile memory store and provide insights into the material basis of memory formation and storage.
